alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Louisa; Muscatine; Scott; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 22 at 6:16AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A snow squall will affect Northwestern Louisa...Jackson...Cedar... Western Scott...Johnson...Northern Washington...Jones...Muscatine and Clinton counties through 745 AM CST... At 615 AM CST, a snow squall was located along a line extending from near Canton to Olin to near Richmond. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Visibilities less than a quarter of a mile, rapidly dropping temperatures and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar and observations. IMPACTS...Ice and snow covered surfaces including roadways, bridges, overpasses, and sidewalks. Difficulty seeing while driving. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Iowa City, Muscatine, Maquoketa, Anamosa, Tipton, West Branch, Durant, Mechanicsville, Stanwood, Coralville, North Liberty, Eldridge, DeWitt, West Liberty, Wilton, Kalona, Solon, Tiffin and Walcott. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 237 and 291. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 280 near mile marker 1. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads could lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. Exit the highway if you are able to and wait for the squall to pass.

area.areaDesc: Cedar; Clinton; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Louisa; Muscatine; Scott; Washington
